abilities.abilityName: Gomu Gomu no Hanabi: Ougon Botan
abilities.description: A variation of Gomu Gomu no Hanabi where Luffy spins his body around while colliding a large golden ball attached to his arm with a thundercloud, using it as an electrical conductor to destroy the cloud.
abilities.significance: Used to destroy Enel's Raigo and save Skypiea from destruction.

abilities.description: Similar to Gomu Gomu no Rifle but with the golden ball attached to Luffy's arm, possessing much more speed and creating a massive sonic boom. The attack is so fast that even opponents who can move at lightning speed cannot dodge it.
abilities.significance: The finishing move that defeated Enel and rang the Golden Bell, ending the Skypiea conflict.

keyMoments.description: Luffy uses Gomu Gomu no Hanabi: Ougon Botan to destroy Enel's Raigo
Luffy defeats Enel with Gomu Gomu no Ougon Rifle, ringing the Golden Bell

abilities.description: Enel's ultimate transformation where he morphs his entire body into a colossal lightning form at maximum voltage (200 million volts). He becomes a huge, potbellied, Raijin-like lightning figure capable of firing enormous electrical bolts from his hands and wielding his gold staff as burning tridents.
abilities.significance: Represents the full extent of the Goro Goro no Mi's power and Enel's desperation to defeat Luffy. Despite its overwhelming might, it proved ineffective against Luffy's rubber body.

keyMoments.description: Enel transforms into his ultimate 200,000,000 Volt Amaru form
Despite the Amaru transformation, Enel is defeated by Luffy

weaknesses.description: Lightning is completely ineffective against rubber, making Luffy a natural counter to Enel's powers.
